metadata.job_title: I want to become a data analyst

jobs.title: Marketing Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Insight Global is looking for a Marketing Operations Analyst to join one of their premium clients in the pharmaceutical space. This person will act as support for the marketing operations function and will bring technical expertise for technical activities, including monitoring and auditing, data anomaly investigation, data validation and file transfer oversight. You will be responsible for working in systems including: Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Data Cloud, Gigya and numerous SQL databases via SQL Studio.
 This person will also own and manage information request management ticket requests which includes database tasks such as:
1. Determining whether there is data in organization’s systems for the requestor
2. Identifying the specific data the organisation has for the requestor
3. Processing data deletion requests
4. Managing "Do Not Share" data requests
 This person will help streamline ad-hoc data ingestion processes and will additionally provide support for other technical functions, such as email deliverability tasks and monitoring engagement metrics.
 Qualifications:
· Experience within marketing operations, data analysis, or related fields
· Experience developing visuals and process diagrams to outline current and future workflows, facilitating cross-functional team discussions and alignment
· Hands-on experience conducting first-level data analysis using ad-hoc queries within the Data Mart for data investigation purposes
· Proficiency in SQL (not expert-level, but regular hands-on use required)
· Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences
· Experience supporting monitoring and troubleshooting efforts across marketing systems

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Healthcare - Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-time/Contract

Full-time Salary Range:  $80K - $100K

Contract Salary Range: $60-$95/hr

About Us

Phamily is a healthcare technology company focused on making proactive care management simple, scalable, and financially sustainable. Our SaaS platform equips health systems and physician groups with AI-powered virtual care tools to better manage chronic conditions and general patient needs between office visits. By shifting healthcare from reactive, episodic treatment to proactive care management, we’ve already supported tens of thousands of patients, and we’re just getting started. Join us as we continue to revolutionize how care is delivered.

Job/Role Description

As a Data Analyst at Phamily, you’ll help teams turn data into decisions, without writing SQL. Leveraging Looker and spreadsheets, you’ll translate complex business questions into clear, trusted insights that drive action across clinical, operational, and product teams. You’ll curate dashboards and self-serve resources, document and validate metrics, and enable stakeholders to confidently explore data on their own.

This role is ideal for an analyst who enjoys storytelling with numbers, shaping business conversations, and empowering others to become more data-driven, while partnering closely with our engineering team for the heavy technical lifting.

Key Responsibilities

Scope, prioritize, and deliver dashboards, reports, and one-pagers to answer stakeholder questions.
Curate and organize content in Looker: Explores, dashboards, descriptions, and table calculations.
Partner with Analytics Engineers to define, document, and maintain consistent metric definitions.
Validate and QA dashboards to ensure data accuracy and build trust with business users. Develop lightweight guides, hold office hours, and train users to increase self-serve adoption.
Handle PHI with care and follow HIPAA-minded best practices.

Requirements

2+ years in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles 
Experience analyzing and presenting data in Looker (consumer/creator level) and spreadsheets.
Strong ability to translate data into compelling stories and actionable recommendations.
Comfort working in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
No SQL required (engineering team owns modeling).
Bonus: Familiarity with healthcare metrics (engagement, operations, revenue) or basic experimentation/segmentation concepts.

Our Compensation & Benefits

Competitive compensation commensurate with experience
Potential to earn equity based on performance
Remote-friendly work environment
Medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents at a nominal cost
Paid maternity leave
FSA and Dependent Care account options
401(k) eligibility after 6 months of full-time employment
Collaborative, mission-driven work environment

If you take pride in delivering results, embrace challenges, and proactively seek improvement, then this is the place for you. You’ll join a smart, humble, and collaborative team dedicated to improving healthcare.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Phamily is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: AI Labeling Analyst - Entry Level
jobs.description:
About the job
Position Title: AI Labeling Analyst - Entry Level 
Location: Remote
Duration: 3+ months with possibility of extension

Job Description:
We are looking for a focused and reliable Labeling Analyst to join our team for a content labeling project. The role involves reviewing various types of content (text/image/video) and assigning accurate labels based on predefined categories.
This work is crucial in supporting machine learning models and improving content recommendation systems.

Key Responsibilities:
Review a wide range of digital content, including text, images, and videos.
Categorize content into predefined labels such as:
Travel
Finance
Health
Shopping
Politics
Entertainment
Others (as defined by the project)
Ensure accurate and consistent tagging based on guidelines.
Flag any ambiguous or borderline content for internal review.
Meet daily/weekly targets with high accuracy.

Requirements:
Strong attention to detail and ability to handle sensitive or explicit content with neutrality.
Excellent reading comprehension and decision-making skills.
Comfortable with repetitive tasks and large volumes of data.
Prior experience in annotation, content moderation, or labeling is a plus.
Ability to work independently and deliver consistently on deadlines.
Some high school education or recent graduates are welcome to apply.




Digitive LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Partner, dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, nationality, caste, disability, or any legally protected characteristic. We ensure opportunities for all, based on skills, qualifications, and performance.

jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
About Us

Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines comprehensive insurance coverage and innovative cybersecurity tools to help businesses manage and mitigate potential cyberattacks.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real—and happening daily at Coalition.

About The Role

Senior Data Analysts at Coalition lead cross-functional analytics that move the business. You will design the measurement strategy for key journeys, build robust data models and dashboards, drive experimentation, and deliver clear recommendations that influence product and revenue leadership. You’ll mentor analysts, set best practices, and raise the bar on data quality, documentation, and insight delivery. Coalition is a remote-first company; many roles can be performed from approved locations.

Responsibilities

Lead and execute cross-functional analytics projects using advanced SQL and data modeling to uncover actionable insights and optimization opportunities.
Develop clear, data-driven recommendations to influence product strategy, improve operational efficiency, and support OKR tracking.
Define and maintain core funnel metrics; design and deliver robust, automated reporting and executive-ready dashboards.
Analyze and synthesize multiple data sources into compelling narratives with prioritized actions for stakeholders.
Partner with data engineering/analytics engineering to build reliable analytical datasets and scalable workflows.
Mentor junior team members; model best practices in SQL, data modeling, documentation, and review processes.

Skills And Qualifications

Proven expertise in SQL (complex modeling, performance optimization) and code hygiene/documentation.
Proficiency in Python or R for analytical workflows, experimentation, and reproducibility.
Strong grasp of analytical methods (hypothesis testing, experiment design, interpretation) and business framing.
Demonstrated experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and building dashboards consumed by leadership.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management; demonstrated ability to influence product and revenue decisions.
Experience collaborating across product, engineering, and operations; comfortable context switching while maintaining quality.
Level calibration aligns with Coalition’s IC framework (P4 typically 6–8+ years relevant experience).

Bonus Points

Experience in insurance, insurtech, cybersecurity, or fintech domains.
Familiarity with tools common to our environment (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Marketo, Salesforce, Segment, Zuora).
Exposure to ETL/analytics engineering (e.g., dbt, Airflow) and/or causal inference methods.
Experience using GenAI-assisted IDEs for analysis or coding (e.g., Cursor, GitHub Copilot).

Compensation

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The US base salary for this position ranges from $134,700/year in our lowest geographic market up to $198,475/year in our highest geographic market. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors, which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process. Coalition, Inc. reserves the right to modify this range as needed.

Perks

100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Annual home office stipend and WeWork access
Mental & physical health wellness programs (One Medical, Headspace, Wellhub, and more)!
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

Why Coalition?

Work at Coalition is centered on the joint mission to Protect the Unprotected. We have built a remote-first, highly inclusive culture that welcomes people from diverse backgrounds. We trust each other to take responsibility, share ownership of outcomes, and put in the work together to protect businesses from digital risk. Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes while remaining true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion.

We’re always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.

Visit our Newsroom > 

Privacy Notice

Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. We collect, use, and store personal information as necessary for the recruitment process and in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations in all regions where we operate. We want you to understand what personal information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding access, correction, and deletion of your data where applicable. Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy. For further details, please review our full Privacy Policy or contact us with any questions regarding how your information is handled.

Our Privacy Policy > 

Anti-Discrimination Notice

Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, without discrimination or harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable laws in each country where we operate. This commitment includes, but is not limited to, ensuring equal treatment in recruitment, selection, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, and all other aspects of employment. Coalition does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace.

Accommodations

Coalition is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in each country where we operate. Our policy is to support equal opportunity in the hiring process by considering qualified applicants regardless of disability or other protected characteristics, unless providing accommodation would impose an undue hardship or disproportionate burden. If you require accommodation to complete an application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participate in the selection process, please contact us at candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com. We also consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in line with applicable laws and regulations in each jurisdiction.

To all potential candidates: Coalition primarily does not use third-party recruiting services. Potential candidates will only be contacted by Coalition, Inc. during the recruitment process. You can always verify any opportunity on our official careers page http://www.coalitioninc.com/careers.

To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
requirements: python or r for analytical workflows

jobs.title: Virtual Data Analyst / Entry Level (Remote)
jobs.description:
About the job
Exciting Career Opportunity - Join Our Team!

We are looking for dedicated and motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our continued success. This position offers a chance to grow professionally in a supportive and inclusive environment, with flexibility and long-term career potential.

Employment Type: Full-Time / Part-Time

Salary Range: $35-40/hr

Job Summary:

The ideal candidate will perform a range of tasks to support daily operations, contribute to team goals, and uphold our standards of excellence. This role requires a proactive attitude, a willingness to learn, and a commitment to quality and professionalism.

Key Responsibilities:


 Support day-to-day operations and team functions
 Maintain accuracy and attention to detail in assigned tasks
 Communicate effectively with team members and clients
 Adhere to company policies, procedures, and deadlines
 Take initiative and show flexibility in handling tasks
 Contribute to a positive and respectful work culture




Qualifications:


 High school diploma or equivalent (college degree a plus)
 Basic computer and communication skills
 Strong organizational and time management abilities
 Ability to work independently or as part of a team
 Adaptable and willing to learn new tools or systems
 Reliable and responsible work ethic




Benefits:


 Competitive salary with opportunities for increases
 Flexible work hours and remote options (if applicable)
 Opportunities for career growth and advancement
 Ongoing training and development
 Health, dental, and vision insurance (if applicable)
 Paid time off and holiday benefits
 Employee support programs and recognition




Take the next step in your career and apply today. We are excited to learn more about you!

jobs.title: Data Analyst (various levels open)
jobs.description:
About the job
About the Job
[VVIP HRCap Clients] Start-ups, PEs, JVs, Global SMBs, Fortune 500s
[Industries] AI, Automotive, Beauty, Consumer Electronics, Cosmetics, Construction, E-Commerce, Energy, EV, Fashion, Financial Services, Healthcare, Investment, Manufacturing, Technology, and more.
[Location] CA, TX, MI, IL, GA, NJ, NY, PA, CT, and more (remote included)


Role Description
Our clients are seeking Data Analysts (various levels open depending on experience and relevant skills) to join their U.S. teams.

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.


Responsibilities
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and mine data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Compile and analyze data specifically related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion


Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
Relevant Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL


===

About us
HRCap, Inc. is a Top 10 Executive Search & HR Consulting Company and the largest Global Asian American Search Firm in the world. Established in 2000, we partner with over 1500 VIP client organizations ranging across Fortune 500s, global medium-sized businesses, PE firms, venture capitals, and tech start-ups across all industries and operate globally with a focus in North America, Europe, and APAC regions. We offer customized workforce strategies, executive search, technical recruiting, succession planning, HR training & development, and executive coaching for effective globalization and localization. We are trusted HR advisors, strategic business partners, and cultural ambassadors to our clients, candidates, and community. www.hrcap.com

jobs.title: REMOTE Data Analyst - Part Time & Full Time
jobs.description:
About the job
Data Analyst Job Summary

We are looking for a detail-oriented and collaborative Data Analyst to join our business analytics team. You must have experience working with large data sets and understand how to manipulate and analyze them using various statistical and mathematical methods. Our marketing and products department will collaborate with you to determine what data should be collected and interpreted. Your goal will be to provide our business analysts with valuable information to forecast trends and improve sales. Candidates must have at least one year of relevant data experience.

Data Analyst Duties And Responsibilities

Analyze data using statistical methods
Create reports to share findings and recommendations with the internal team and other stakeholders
Collaborate with leaders and managers to determine and address data and reporting needs for various company projects
Create statistical models that depict company-wide trends
Perform testing and validation of data sets
Document structures and types of business data

Data Analyst Requirements And Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information technology, or related field preferred
1+ years of experience in a data analyst or relevant role
Strong analytical capabilities
Expert with Microsoft Excel and various business intelligence and analytical tools
Understanding of data gathering, inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling/diagramming techniques
Keen attention to detail
Excellent communication skills

jobs.title: Junior Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Major apparel company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our growing Data & Analytics team. You’ll play a key role in building reports, dashboards, and insights that drive business decisions across Sales, Inventory, and Operations.

You’ll work closely with senior analysts, IT, and business leaders to connect data from our BlueCherry ERP, Power BI, and other systems—helping turn raw information into actionable insights. This role offers exposure to data governance, automation, and AI-driven analytics within a dynamic apparel wholesale environment.

What You’ll Do
Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports across sales, costing, and inventory
Extract, clean, and analyze data from BlueCherry ERP and related databases
Write and optimize SQL queries for reporting and troubleshooting
Support data validation, audit reports, and ad hoc business requests
Use Excel (Pivot Tables, Power Query, Macros) for deep-dive analysis and forecasting
Leverage AI tools (Copilot, ChatGPT, Power Automate) to streamline report generation and exception management
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Sales, Finance, Operations) to deliver business intelligence solutions
Maintain documentation and promote data governance best practices

Who You Are
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business, or a related field
1–3 years of data analytics or reporting experience
Advanced Excel skills (formulas, modeling, automation)
Working knowledge of Power BI (DAX, modeling, visualization)
Solid understanding of SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with BlueCherry ERP or other ERP systems (SAP, NetSuite, etc.)
Curiosity for learning AI and automation tools
Organized, detail-oriented, and eager to solve data challenges

Excellent Benefits. Salary is commensurate with experience.
requirements: bluecherry erp or other erp systems (sap

jobs.title: Entry Level Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Entry-Level Data Analyst (Remote – USA)
Location: Remote (USA) | Open to all time zones
 Employment Type: Full-Time | Entry Level
 Visa: OPT, CPT, GC, H4-EAD, TN Holders Only
About the Role:
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our analytics team. The ideal candidate is passionate about data, eager to learn modern analytical tools, and ready to support data-driven decision-making across business operations.
Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and analyze structured and unstructured datasets from multiple sources.
Build dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel to track KPIs.
Assist in creating and maintaining SQL queries, data pipelines, and ad-hoc reports.
Support cross-functional teams in identifying trends, patterns, and insights.
Document processes, data definitions, and visualization logic.
Collaborate with data engineers and business analysts on ETL workflows and data validation.
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL and Excel; exposure to Python or R preferred.
Familiarity with Power BI or Tableau for data visualization.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
Authorization: Must be on OPT, CPT, GC, H4-EAD, or TN visa.
Preferred Skills (Nice to Have):
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL tools.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Experience with statistical analysis or machine learning basics.
requirements: sql and excel; exposure to python or r preferred
statistical analysis or machine learning basics
data warehousing concepts and etl tools
power bi or tableau for data visualization

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
*** W2 Contract Only – No C2C – No 3rd Parties ***
Summary
The Ash Group is hiring a remote Data Analyst to support a major electricity and natural gas utility provider. This role plays a key part in maintaining and analyzing GIS and database systems to support a critical wildfire mitigation program, ensuring data accuracy and integrity across engineering and communications systems.

Compensation & Benefits
Competitive pay rate at $34 per hour, medical, dental, vision, and direct primary care benefits, and, after six months of employment, a 4% matched 401(k) plan with immediate 100% vesting.
Duration: 3-month contract with potential to extend or convert
Location: Fully remote position for U.S.-based candidates
Schedule: Standard business hours (8:00 AM–4:30 PM), 40 hours/week
Citizenship Requirement: U.S. Citizenship or Green Card required

What You’ll Be Doing
Analyze, validate, and maintain GIS and Access database data for accuracy and completeness.
Support new device installations and maintenance of existing equipment.
Verify templates and data accuracy for engineering and communications systems.
Manage the Common Device Database and process data requests.
Collaborate with engineering, GIS, and project management teams to resolve data discrepancies.
Create and publish scheduled and ad hoc reports.
Document reporting requirements and validate data components.

What We’re Looking For
2–4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in utilities or communications.
Strong GIS background and experience with Access databases.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, SharePoint).
Effective data validation and analysis skills.
Familiarity with distribution management systems (DMS) is a plus.

Preferred Skills
Experience with advanced database management and process automation.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Self-starter with excellent time management and organizational abilities.
Process improvement mindset and initiative to enhance data systems.


If you're a detail-oriented data analyst with a passion for GIS and database accuracy, this remote opportunity offers a chance to support a high-impact wildfire mitigation program in a collaborative and mission-driven environment. Apply now to contribute to critical infrastructure and safety initiatives.


#DataAnalyst #RemoteJobs #GISJobs #UtilitiesCareers #ExcelJobs #AccessDatabase #SharePoint #WildfireMitigation #DataValidation #ProcessImprovement
requirements: advanced database management and process automation
distribution management systems (dms) is a plus
